website_summaries.verdict: A good all-around choice that can handle a wide range of fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.
pros: Easy access, 3-step filtration system successfully prevents clogs
Shutoff value on wand to prevent drips
cons: Requires a lot of pumping to keep the pressure at maximum

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!!! Not For Professional Use
customer_reviews.text: After using this product for less than two weeks it is already leaking. This is not a "pro series" by any stretch. Horrible just horrible. I have been using backpack sprayers (Lesco, Solo) for 7+ years now for herbicide applications-- this is THE WORST EVER! Save yourself the time, money, hassle, and herbicide leaking down your back, legs, shoes, and lawn-- buy something else this is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Works great. Only negative is that the measurements are on the back of the tank. This makes it difficult when you are applying a specific amount in multiple areas using one tank. Easy fix - use a permanent marker and follow the measurement lines from the back of the tank to the side. With this done, you can glance to your side while applying and easily see how much you applied/is remaining.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Poor Instructions, Poor Illustrations, Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: Customer Support at Chapin was initially unresponsive, apparently due to website issues. The issues have been resolved, and Chapin has gone above and beyond to remedy the problem. A replacement sprayer was shipped overnight UPS. I am satisfied and impressed with Chapin's Customer Service. The pump handle makes no sense to me. The handle when mounted is virtually vertical, 90 degrees, in mid throw, The range of motion is from about 60 to 120 degrees. It is unreachable. The only other mounting option is 180 degrees, handle pointing virtually straight down. The instruction manual is very poorly illustrated. I do not know if I am missing a part (Ido not believe so). The mounting is the same left or right.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sheridan Jr

customer_reviews.title: Simple and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. I bought a 96 oz container of pesticide concentrate when I bought this. Instead of paying someone $90/quarter I pay less than that for the concentrate and get a few years of treatment. I used to be a pest control technician and you can buy the products that they use and if you read the label you can legally make it more concentrated than the company servicing your house will. I also use this for weed spray.
customer_reviews.author: drichardson

customer_reviews.title: Pumping Causes It To Twist On Your Back!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great about this backpack sprayer except having to pump it so much! The harness doesn't keep it from moving all over your back as you pump - when you push down, it twists it to the other side. Please put a harness on it that will fasten solidly around your waist, and you'll have a great product. Too much work for a 68-year-old, so I bit the bullet and bought a battery powered unit!
customer_reviews.author: BillATech11

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer - I just use it for my lawn
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer - I just use it for my lawn, nothing too heavy duty or for extended periods of time. I forgot to bring it in when it started to freeze and the tripper snapped (my fault) - found a replacement from the Chapin website for $16 - delivered fast and the customer service was excellent. This is way easier on your back compare to those you just hold and bend over with. Plus you get to look a bit like a Ghostbuster.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Chapin 61800 4Gal Backpack Sprayer, 4-Gallon
customer_reviews.text: I Do NOT Recommend purchasing this Unit! Yes, it is easy to Assemble, HOWEVER, to use after you fill it (and I only filled to 3-1/2 Gal.) you must Constantly and Continuously Pump the Pressure Lever to maintain a proper Spray Pressure. NOT Acceptable. AND, wen you Return to Amazon, They DO NOT Credit you the Full amount, they deduct approx 18% of what you invested! Poor Policy for selling a not very good Product!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great Manual Pumper
customer_reviews.text: Tank is 4 gallons. Maintains a good pressure with minimal pumping. I caution anyone, 4 gallons of fluid is not light on the shoulders and back. Padded straps help but you'll still have some soreness in collarbone area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sprayer, but.....
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sprayer, but spend the extra $20 for the 61900, it's well worth it. I own both the 61800 and the 61900 and wish I had just bought two 61900's. The 61900 is almost identical except for several improved features, such as a much more comfortable belt and shoulder strap assembly, a better spray wand, a pressure gauge, much more easily accessible filter, etc, well worth the extra $20. The 61800's straps leave my shoulders sore after a full tank of spraying, while the 61900 doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: No more weeds!
customer_reviews.text: works great. The only gripe is its not real comfortable when full. Not sure thats a relivent gripe, but there it is. I would recommend it and will use this a few times a year for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product all in all, easy to use, comfortable on the back. There is just a little lock for the hand piece made of cheap plastic that got destroyed on the first use. Luckly I don't really use it.
customer_reviews.author: Wander Alcaraz

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy as you would guess.
customer_reviews.text: Pump easy to use and not as heavy as I imagined when full. Lets you mix and apply useful quanities of pesticide rather than spending half of your day walking back and forth to mix gallon quanities. Down side is I broke the wand on the second tank full. I'll take half of the hlame for pulling on it but there is no reason to use such fragile plastic these days.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Deckmann

customer_reviews.title: It works well as a sprayer.  No frills, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a sprayer. No frills, but it does the job. Downside is the awkward shape for storage and transport when it comes to the base, hose, wand and pump handle...but I think those downsides may plague any backpack sprayer at this price. It is a good sprayer though. Solid construction. Doesn't leak. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Crash-N-Burn

customer_reviews.title: Handle does not store in the up position
customer_reviews.text: You will notice in the photo and on the box that the handle is shown stored in the up position. This is a feature I was looking for, because how things are stored in the truck is important for commercial use. Although they advertise with photo that it can be stored this way it actually can not. This is extremely frustrating. All in all the backpack sprayer works okay although I don't expect it will last long. However it was inexpensive so you get what you pay for. However I am pissed about the false presentation via photo. Get it together Chapin!!!
customer_reviews.author: brian egan

customer_reviews.title: great sprayer
customer_reviews.text: awesome sprayer. the tip has so many options for spray streams. large capacity helps to cover large area on a single mix. I like that the pump handle can be put on either side of the sprayer. minimum pumping required to pressure up the sprayer. this is my 2nd sprayer. the first one lasted over 5 years of heavy use. highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: it's okay
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used it, it leaked at the base where the hose is connected. We tightened that up and it worked great. The second time we used it, it leaked all over his back while he had it on. Could not find where it was leaking from, so he released so of the pressure and that seemed to stop the leak. I realize that this may have been user error, but if it was leaking because it was over compressed, it seems like it wouldn't allow you to continue to add air. The little cheap handheld one we used previously had that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hart

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer, and much easier to use than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good sprayer, and much easier to use than the 1 and 2-gallon ones you carry around with one hand. My only complaint concerns the snap-on storage position for the wand. It's a great idea, but the wand comes off too easily if you accidentally bump the wand, e.g. while setting the pack down. That said, I like the way the unit sprays, which is fully adjustable, and it is comfortable to wear. 4 gallons is a good size. If you're covering a large area, 2 gallons goes really fast; but more than 4 would be very heavy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Remy's Uncle

customer_reviews.title: Great value and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy! Been using a hand help u it. Had to constantly fill and pump - this sprays much better, is much quicker, and barely costs more than a hand held sprayer
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Spray Away!
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack sprayer. If you can haul ~25 pounds on your back, this is the sprayer to get. Load it up and spray away. It's much more convenient than the 2g hand held sprayers. We use it to spray round-up on our fence line and 4g goes a long way. Very sturdy and so far very reliable. Chapin makes good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ~~Joe~~

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer. This is my second and they have lasted well(7+ years). My previous sprayer wand had a small crack and it will serve as parts replacement if my new sprayer has any issues.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this backpack sprayer has worked very well for me. The spray tip is not as refined perhaps as some of the profession models but this unit is very well made for the price. I've used it for insect control around the exterior of the house and can spray the soffets on the second level with some success. I think if I care for it and keep it clean and dry when not in use I'll get years of good service from it.
customer_reviews.author: brobzzz

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a month. Have probably put 50 gallons thru it. It works perfect as advertised. Seems to be as comfortable as it could be considering it weighs 45 pounds when full. Absolutely no problems, or leaks, etc. NO COMPARISON to packing around and using a 3 gallon regular sprayer. With a 3 gallon always stopping, pumping it up and going again......and awkward to carry........with the backpack unit I can continue spraying and walking while occasionally putting a few pumps in. My regret is I didn't get one 20 years and many thousands of gallons of spray ago!!
customer_reviews.author: Nail

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I received this sprayer. It has a substantial build compared to others on the market at this price point. The most pleasant surprise was when I filled it with 4 gallons of solution and hoisted it onto my back. I could not believe how comfortable it was (at least as comfortable as 4 gallons of water can be--heavy!). This is the fourth backpack sprayer I have owned and it is by far the best for a homeowner. The tip adjusts easily to wide or narrow spray pattern and it needs very little pumping compared to some of the others I have owned!
customer_reviews.author: T. Hiemenz

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool to have when you need to spray a large amount but can't get a vehicle in the area to carry a bigger tank. I used this sprayer over the weekend to apply water sealer (waterproofing) to our new privacy fence. Let's just say there is enough wood which required about 20 gallons of the sealer and I sprayed it with full coverage in less than 2 hours. It was very easy too use and very easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Vykon

customer_reviews.title: Very worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This baby cut my spraying time from 1.5 hours to 15 minutes. No more excessive forearm workout from squeezing a bottle 1000 times or awkwardly dragging a 1 gallon bottle around while trying to spray and pump at the same time. Great product. Quit wasting your time and order this sprayer. I've used many sprayers over the years for work and this works great for the house.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage. Lasted less than 60 days before the pump housing developed a leak. Used this sprayer all of 2 hours total before having to toss it in the trash. Make sure you read the limited returns window for this item. I advise you try another make/model. Complete loss for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Taylor

customer_reviews.title: So far I am immensely pleased. I had a chargeable unit before this one ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I am immensely pleased. I had a chargeable unit before this one and it crapped out on me after very little use. This manual style is far easier to use than you might think. A few pumps of the lever and you are good for a while. For the price, it is THE way to go. CHAPIN HAS GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE, BTW! Amazing and a shining example of how ALL businesses should operate! I dealt with them in the past and was so pleased that I made sure to by their brand again.
customer_reviews.author: WoolyBully

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this sprayer because it is very powerful and easy to to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Huge time saver
customer_reviews.text: I used to spend hours spraying about 4 gallons of pesticide around my foundations. With this sprayer, not only do I just fill it once, it has more pressure and sprays faster. It also has triple filters so it has never clogged.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cihak

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment. Broke on me during the second use

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

It's also heavy when full which makes it difficult and cumbersome to use when on a ladder.It also lost pressure quicker than we expected.In the end my husband gave up and purchased a two gallon hand held sprayer at amazon for $14.99 which worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: tiana

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you cannot beat this sprayer. I have a huge brick drive and walkway, and my previous sprayers required multiple refills and required back-breaking effort when spraying for weeds. This is relatively comfortable to wear, holds enough fluid for me to complete my job in one fill, and the long handle and hose prevents the back pain caused by constant bending. Assembly was very easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: TomP

customer_reviews.title: I gave this item 4 stars because of the price ...

The one from SAM's was branded Stanley, but it's the same exact product. So, if you need a backpack sprayer, get yours from SAM's club and save yourself around $25.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Johnson & Amy Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I’d prefer a battery powered sprayer.

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this sprayer, it leaked poison all down my back

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I used it about 6 times per year, maybe 15 times total. Pump will no longer pressurize the tank. Won't be getting another.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I have used this sprayer for several years now, and have no complaints at all.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: As the old Chapin Sprayer developed a severe leak in the tank, the 61800 model was purchased. The widen filling mouth makes it easier to fill, and the sprayer pump allows for faster coverage.
customer_reviews.author: lThe Duke of, Dunc

You have to move it only ever so slightly.

customer_reviews.title: Great if you’re left handed.
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward as the spray wand is on the left side...I’m right handed. Works good. Need more nozzle shapes.

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later, still working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this sprayer for about 2 years now and it still works great. I was tired of the cheap, top pump sprayers breaking after a few weeks and went with this backpack sprayer. Still, there are no leaks and it operates great. My only issue is that, at 6'4" and wide shoulders, the straps don't quite adjust long enough for me so it's difficult to take on and off.
customer_reviews.author: ManKitten

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sprayer - super easy to use and made spraying deck stain simple!

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack sprayer

Honestly I mix up my Biffen per the label, take 10 minutes and my house is ready for another month.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Too heavy for me to put more than ...

customer_reviews.author: CompletelyComputers

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Cuts my spraying time in half.

customer_reviews.title: Spray Em

customer_reviews.title: This works so much better than the smaller hand pump versions

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price

customer_reviews.author: tsaro

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent for me as I sprayed my 2000 trees! As good on the 1st tank as the last. No major problems but be sure you tighten all bolts and clamps before you use it. My hose blew off after a couple hours because the clamp came loose. Lost a little mix but was fine from there on out. The directions left a little to be desired. I had to figure out which nozzle worked best for me by trial and error. But all in all I was happy with this item.

Every time I use the sprayer I have to reattach these snaps because they don't stay on. If there is a weakness to this item, it is the bottom snaps. I envision having to replace them frequently. Otherwise, the sprayer works great.

customer_reviews.text: Cool works. I do pest control and use it often. They work for a few years and the parts are too expense to replace. But great while it works.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: POOR SPRAYER
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sprayer, only last thru 2 sprayings, then would not build pressure, only had 40 days, no return by Amazon since I had it more than 30 days, which sucks!!! Will never buy this manufacturer again, better off spending more and getting a product that won't break down in less than two months. If I could give it a 0 star rating I would...
customer_reviews.author: jmiller888

customer_reviews.title: Decent sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these sprayers from Amazon to spray weeds/pesticides. The 1st one has lasted me almost a year,, overall i would say that i expected it to last longer. The problem is the pump quality. After awhile it doesn't hold it's pressure, so thus leaks from some point. The straps/wand/tank all work very/very well and are comparable to a solo, but the pump is very lacking and without the pump working then the sprayer doesn't work and is to me worthless. They were worth a try because a comparable solo cost $100 but i imagine a solo will outlast 3 of the chapins..
customer_reviews.author: kdxrider

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle limitations
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this sprayer works well except the actual quality of the spray. The nozzle only allows for a very fine mist, and it takes forever to administer a quantity of liquid spray to a large area.
customer_reviews.author: Groovesister

customer_reviews.title: Much Easier Than the Small Tanks
customer_reviews.text: I had been using 1 and 2 gallon tanks but had more trees to spray this year. Purchased the Chapin 61800 and worked like a champ. I can cover all the trees and the garden in one tank in 20 minutes. Spray is nice and clean-up is easy. Take the advice of someone earlier and set it up on a bench to back into the back straps, it is much easier and comfortable than trying to sling a full tank around you.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid machine that performs very well. Had a minor problem with the little plastic lockdown piece on the hand wand and within two days they sent me a whole new hand wand. First class way to run a business. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: woodskill

customer_reviews.title: Dad recommended to me and I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Works for all kinds of longer spraying tasks. I have a large yard with lots of flower beds and a two-level deck that likes to grow mold. So, this lets me carry a great capacity of liquid and--most importantly--pump as I work. Would buy this over and over again. Solid construction too.

customer_reviews.title: back pack sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered product. Received in three days. Wonderful service from amazon.com. Thank you. This back pack sprayer has performed well. Important to read entire instruction manual before using. Has pressure adjustment inside tank that you will need to be familiar with before using. I have found that this sprayer is able to cover more area with less liquid than the one that I bought eight years ago. Only problem was with the handle pump grip.
